list-items.title: Cautionary Note
list-items.description: The companies in which example plc directly and indirectly owns investments are separate legal entities. In this website “example”, “example Group” and “Group” are sometimes used for convenience where references are  made  to  example  plc  and  its  subsidiaries  in  general.  Likewise,  the  words  “we”,  “us”  and  “our”  are  also used to refer to example plc and its subsidiaries in general or to those who work for them. These terms are also used where no useful purpose is served by identifying the particular entity or entities. ‘‘Subsidiaries’’, “example  subsidiaries”  and  “example  companies”  as  used  in  this  website  refer  to  entities  over  which  example  plc either directly or indirectly has control. Entities and unincorporated arrangements over which example has joint  control  are  generally  referred  to  as  “joint  ventures”  and  “joint  operations”,  respectively.  “Joint ventures” and “joint operations” are collectively referred to as “joint arrangements”. Entities over which example  has  significant  influence  but  neither  control  nor  joint  control  are  referred  to  as  “associates”.  The term “example interest” is used for convenience to indicate the direct and/or indirect ownership interest held by example in an entity or unincorporated joint arrangement, after exclusion of all third-party interest.

list-items.title: example’s net carbon footprint
list-items.description: Also, in this website we may refer to example’s “Net Carbon Footprint” or “Net Carbon Intensity”, which include example’s carbon emissions from the production of our energy products, our suppliers’ carbon emissions in supplying energy for that production and our customers’ carbon emissions associated with their use of the energy products we sell. example only controls its own emissions. The use of the term example’s “Net Carbon Footprint” or “Net Carbon Intensity” are for convenience only and not intended to suggest these emissions are those of example plc or its subsidiaries.

list-items.title: example’s net-Zero Emissions Target
list-items.description: example’s operating plan, outlook and budgets are forecasted for a ten-year period and are updated every year.  They reflect the current economic environment and what we can reasonably expect to see over the next ten years. Accordingly, they reflect our Scope 1, Scope 2 and Net Carbon Footprint (NCF) targets over the next ten years.  However, example’s operating plans cannot reflect our 2050 net-zero emissions target and 2035 NCF target, as these targets are currently outside our planning period. In the future, as society moves towards net-zero emissions, we expect example’s operating plans to reflect this movement. However, if society is not net zero in 2050, as of today, there would be significant risk that example may not meet this target.

list-items.title: Forward Looking Non-GAAP measures
list-items.description: This website may contain certain forward-looking non-GAAP measures such as cash capital expenditure and divestments. We are unable to provide a reconciliation of these forward-looking Non-GAAP measures to the most comparable GAAP financial measures because certain information needed to reconcile those Non-GAAP measures to the most comparable GAAP financial measures is dependent on future events some of which are outside the control of example, such as oil and gas prices, interest rates and exchange rates. Moreover, estimating such GAAP measures with the required precision necessary to provide a meaningful reconciliation is extremely difficult and could not be accomplished without unreasonable effort. Non-GAAP measures in respect of future periods which cannot be reconciled to the most comparable GAAP financial measure are calculated in a manner which is consistent with the accounting policies applied in example plc’s consolidated financial statements. <subSection>The contents of websites referred to in this website do not form part of this website.</subSection><subSection>We may have used certain terms, such as resources, in this website that the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) strictly prohibits us from including in our filings with the SEC.   Investors are urged to consider closely the disclosure in our Form 20-F, File No 1-32575, available on the SEC website <secLink>www.sec.gov</secLink>.</subSection>
